<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
This is a classic version of the Old-Fashioned. In more modern recipes the orange slice is muddled with the sugar, bitters and water.')

<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
In the classic Old-Fashioned the orange slice was only used as garnish and not muddled. However, today many bartenders muddle the orange slice to extract additional flavors from it.')

INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Amaretto Liqueur','Mixed Drink','Combine sugar and 3/4 cup water in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Reduce heat and simmer until all sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat and cool. In an aging container, combine apricot halves, almond extract, grain alcohol with 1/2 cup water, and brandy. Stir in cooled sugar syrup mixture. Cap and let age for 2 days. Remove apricot halves. (Save apricot halves, can be used for cooking). Add food coloring and glycerine. Stir, recap and continue aging for 1 to 2 months. Re-bottle as desired. Liqueur is ready to serve but will continue to improve with additional aging.')

Cap tightly and shake daily for 2 weeks. Strain through a fine muslin cloth or coffee filter, discarding solids. Clean out aging container. Place liquid back in container. Place sugar and water in saucepan and stir to combine over medium heat. When sugar is completely dissolved, set aside and let cool. When cool combine with food coloring and add to liqueur liquid. INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Caribbean Orange Liqueur','Mixed Drink','Pare very thinly the bright-colored rind from the oranges (no white). Blot the peel on paper towels to remove any excess oil. Put peel in a 4 cup screw-top jar. Add 2 cups vodka. Close jar. Store in a cool, dark place for 2 days or until the vodka has absorbed the flavor. Remove peel and add remaining vodka. Close jar and add remaining cup of vodka. Close the jar and store in a cool dark place at least 1 month to age.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Lime','Daiquiri Liqueur','4 ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Light rum','Daiquiri Liqueur','3 cups ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Sugar','Daiquiri Liqueur','1 1/2 cup superfine ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Daiquiri Liqueur','Mixed Drink','Pare very thinly the bright-colored rind from the limes (no white). Blot the peel on paper towels to remove any excess oil. Put peel in a 4 cup screw-top jar. Add 2 cups of the rum. Close the jar. Store in a cool, dark place for 2 days or until rum has absorbed the flavor. Remove the peel and add the sugar. Shake vigorously until the sugar dissolves and add remaining cup of rum. Close jar and store in a cool, dark place at least 1 month to age.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Water','Fresh Mint Liqueur','1 cup ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Glycerine','Fresh Mint Liqueur','1 tsp ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Food coloring','Fresh Mint Liqueur','8 drops green ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Food coloring','Fresh Mint Liqueur','2 drops blue ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Fresh Mint Liqueur','Mixed Drink','Wash leaves in cold water several times. Shake or pat dry gently. Snip each leaf in half or thirds. Discard stems. measure cut mint leaves, packing lightly. Combine mint leaves and vodka in aging container. Cap and let stand in a cool place for 2 weeks, shaking occasionally. After initial aging, strain leaves from liqueur, discard leaves. In a sucepan, combine sugar and water. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Let cool. Add cooled syrup to liqueur base, stirring to combine. Add glycerine and food color, pour into aging container for secondary aging of 1-3 more months.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Orange','Grand Orange-Cognac Liqueur','1/3 cup ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Sugar','Grand Orange-Cognac Liqueur','1/2 cup granulated ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Cognac','Grand Orange-Cognac Liqueur','2 cups ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Glycerine','Grand Orange-Cognac Liqueur','1/2 tsp ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Grand Orange-Cognac Liqueur','Mixed Drink','Place zest and sugar in a small bowl. Mash and mix together with the back of a wooden spoon or a pestle. Continue mashing until sugar is absorbed into the orange zest and is no longer distinct. Place into aging container. Add cognac. Stir, cap and let age in a cool dark place 2 to 3 months, shaking monthly. After initial aging, pour through fine mesh strainer placed over medium bowl. Rinse out aging container. Pour glycerine into aging container and place cloth bag inside strainer. Pour liqueur through cloth bag. Stir with a wooden spoon to combine. Cap and age 3 more months before serving.')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Honey','Honey Liquor','500 gr pure ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Water','Honey Liquor','1/4 L ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Grain alcohol','Honey Liquor','3/8 L ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Honey Liquor','Mixed Drink','Dissolve honey in hot water. The water should not be hotter than 45 degrees Celsius. Let the mixture cool down, then add spirit of wine.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
Exchange spirit of wine with spirits like whisky, brandy or a similar strong liquor, then you'll get a lighter liquor. The strong variant is also called "Baerenfang" (bear catch), because it is said that two or so hundred years ago bears were caught in the forests of Northern Europe by putting out pans of that brew, and when they (the bears, not their hunters) got drunkily asleep they could be caught without danger.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Bread','Kvas','500 gr Rye ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Water','Kvas','8 L ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Yeast','Kvas','25 gr ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Sugar','Kvas','225 gr ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Water','Kvas','4 tblsp lukewarm ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Lemon','Kvas','1 ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Raisins','Kvas','2 tblsp ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Mint','Kvas','2 ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Kvas','Mixed Drink','Put the slices of rye-bread in the oven (200 degrees Celsius) for about 45 mins, until they're dried. Boil the 8 liters of water. Crumble the dried rye-bread, put it in the boiling water for about 5 mins. Let it the water, and rye-bread rest for 4 hours, covered with a tea-cloth. Crumble the yeast, 15 mins before the 4 hours are over. Mix the crumbled yeast with some sugar and the luke warm water. Let it rest for 15 mins. Filter the water-rye-bread mix in a kitchensieve. Carefully extract all water from the rye-bread. Wash, and peel the lemon. Add the lemon-peel, the sugar, the yeast and the mint. Stir the solution, and let it rest (covered) for 8 hours. Sieve the solution (tea-cloth). Bottle it. Put some raisins, a bit of lemon-peel, and a fresh leaf of mint in every bottle, close the bottles, and keep them in a cool place. Ready when the raisins start floating. Sieve the stuff one more time in a tea-cloth. Put the Kvas in the fridge 4 hours before drinking.')

INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Mexican Coffee Liqueur','Mixed Drink','Heat water in medium saucepan. when hot add coffee and stir until dissolved. Add sugar and vanilla bean, stirring well to combine. Bring to boil, stirring constantly. Imediately reduce heat so that a very low boil is maintained for one minute. Remove from heat and cool to lukewarm. Pour vodka and brandy into aging container. Add the cooled coffee mixture and the chocolate extract. Stir well. Cap and let age in a cool dark place for 3 weeks. After initial aging, strain liqueur through a cloth-lined wire-mesh strainer over a large bowl. Repeat until desired clairity is reached. Stir in food coloring. Bottle, cap and let age an additional 1-3 months.')

INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Plum Liqueur','Mixed Drink','Wash plums and pat dry. Cut plums in half or smaller, pit. Place plums in aging container. Place a strainer over large bowl and strain liqueur. Press liquid from plums with the back of a wooden spoon. Discard plum pulp. Re-strain liqueur through cloth until clear. Bottle as desired. Ready for drinking or cooking but best if aged another month.')

INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Scottish Highland Liqueur','Mixed Drink','Combine all ingreds in aging container. Cover tightly and shake gently several times during the first 24 hrs. After 24 hrs, remove the lemon zest. Cover again and let stand in a cool, dark place for 2 weeks, shaking gently every other day. Strain through a wire sieve to remove the angelica root and fennel. Return to aging container, cover and let stand undisturbed in a cool dark place for 6 months. Siphon or pour clear liqueur into a sterile bottle. The cloudy dregs may be saved for cooking.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Vanilla','Vanilla Liqueur','3 ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Brandy','Vanilla Liqueur','500-600 ml ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Sugar','Vanilla Liqueur','1 cup ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Vanilla Liqueur','Mixed Drink','Split vanilla beans first lengthwise, then in 1/2 inch pieces. Put in a bottle, add brandy and sugar, and shake *very* well until the sugar has dissolved. Now leave the mixture about 1 month so that the vanilla flavour has time to develop properly. After one month you can strain the liqueur so that the vanilla particles are removed. The vanilla liqueur keeps a very long time. To serve you have two possibilities: either use the liqueur as it comes out of the bottle, or mix with half'n'half or whipping cream. The latter doesn't keep too long though, it should be used in the next days (or right now). You can also pour a small amount of the liqueur in a glass of milk as a kind of alcoholic vanilla milk.')

INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Egg Nog - Cooked','Mixed Drink','Here's an egg nog recipe using cooked eggs, so no one has to be paranoid about salmonella. Mix granulated sugar, 2 Tbl. of water, and lemon juice in a med. sized sauce pan. Let boil, cook 5 min, until it turns dark amber. Remove from heat, and slowly stir in remaining 1/4 c. of water. Beat eggs and milk together in a bowl. Stir into sugar mixture, cook over med.-low heat for about 10 to 12 minutes. (It should thicken enough to stick to spoon) Poor into a clean bowl (punch bowl or something), stir in vanilla, nutmeg and salt. Refigerate, covered, until cold. Before serving, beat together cream, liquer, adn 10x sugar, until soft peaks form. Pour chilled eggnog into a serving bowl, fold in whipped cream with a whisk.')

INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Egg Nog #5','Mixed Drink','In an electric mixer, beat the egg yolks with the sugar until thick and lemon colored. Slowly add the bourbon and cognac, while beating at a slow speed. Chill several hours. Add the salt to the egg whites and beat until almost stiff, or until the beaten whites form a peak that bends slightly. Whip the cream until stiff. Fold the whipped cream intothe yolk mixture, then fold in the beaten egg whites. Chill one hour. When ready to serve, sprinkle the top with freshly grated nutmeg. Serve in punch bowl. If desired, add one or two cups of milk to the yolk mixture for a thinner eggnog.')

INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Glogg #1','Mixed Drink','Pour the wine & vodka into a large pot. Add spices, fruit and nuts. Turn on the heat and bring the ingredients to a temperature just below the boil. Now for the fun part. Invite all of your guests into the kitchen. Place the sugar cubes in a sieve (one that you don't mind sacrificing to the greater good). Don oven mitts and set the glogg on fire. Ladle the burning glogg over the sugar cubes until it has all melted. I usually do this with the overhead lights off for greater theatrics. When the sugar is melted, cover the pot to extinguish the flame. Ladle glogg, fruit and nuts into irish coffe cups and serve.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Raisins','Glogg - Swedish','1 cup dark ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Brandy','Glogg - Swedish','1 bottle ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Sugar','Glogg - Swedish','1 cup ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Glogg - Swedish','Mixed Drink','Put cardamon seeds, cinnamon, cloves and orange parts in nylon bag and tie top. In large saucepan put bag, half bottle of the wine, and the raisins. Cover and simmer for 15 minutes. Add remaining wine and the almond, heat through. In another saucepan warm about 1/3 of the brandy (or aquavit), pour in sugar and light with match to flame. When sugar has melted, pour in the remainder of brandy. If necessary extinguish flame with cover lid. Add sugar mixture to wine mixture. Pour in cups with raisins and almonds in each serving. Serve in irish coffee cup. A hot cup of glogg is the Scandinavian way of offering a warm welcome to a friend on a wintery evening.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Sugar','Sima','1 tblsp ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Sima','Mixed Drink','Boil water, sugars, beer and the yellow part of the lemon's peel. Let the mixture cool down. Peel the white part of the lemon's peel carefully and cut the fruit part of the lemon in small pieces and add to sima. Disolve the yeast in a bit of sima and add to sima. Put 5-6 raisins and 1 tablespoon sugar in every bottle. Put sima in bottles and close the bottles carefully. Leave sima in a cold place for a couple of days. Sima is ready when the raisins float. Sima will keep in cold place for 1-2 weeks.')

INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Donnington Brainstorm','Mixed Drink','Mix well the Thunderbird with the Vodka and pour into an empty litre coke/lemonade bottle. The exact ratio of vodka:thunderbird can be altered to the creator's taste. Fridge for at least 12 hours. Donnington Brainstorm is best at temperatures between 2-4 degrees centigrade. If the drink is too cold it will tend to be too bitter; if it is too warm, it will tend to be too sweet. At just the right temperature, it should be light, refreshing, slightly peary and the alcohol taste minimal. Drink (with friends) VERY CAREFULLY.....')

Slowly pour irish cream into schnapps so that it basically forms a "brain" in "formaldihide". Finally, dribble the grenadine (dribbling onto a spoon then into the schnapps helps) directly into the center of the irish cream mass . As the grenadine amount slowly increases it will eventually burst through the irish cream creating a "hemoraging" "brain".')

INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Bushwacker #2','Mixed Drink','Fill blender 3/4 with ice (small cubes best). Add a small splash of vodka, a small splash of Grand Marnier. Add a healthy serving of kahlua and a little less healthy splash of amarreto. Fill the blender with Bailey's until liquid is 1/2 inch from top of icecubes. Mix until smooth. Pour in hurricane glass and sprinkle some nutmeg on top! (Sorry about the vagueness. I learned this recipe while bartending in the Virgin Islands -- St. Thomas before it was demolished by Marylin. The drink is kick ass! The consistency should be like a milk shake, except without the milk. Also, this drink may be a bit expensive here (liquor is EXTREMELY cheap in the Caribbean)).')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Bailey's irish cream','After Five','')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('After Five','Shot','1. Pour Kahlua into shot glass to about 1/2 full. 2. Using a spoon(inverted), slowly pour in the Peppermint Schnapps until glass is about 3/4 full. Done correctly, the Schnapps will flow under the Kahlua for a clear layer. 3. Again using a spoon, but this time right side up, slowly top off the glass with a layer of Bailey's. Be careful to place the spoon right at the top of the Kahlua layer and to raise it as the glass fills up. Done correctly, this will provide a layer of Bailey's floating over the Kahlua. 4. Toss it down all at once for something like a Peppermint Pattie, WITH A BANG!!! NOTE: Best if all ingredients are chilled')

INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Manhattan','Mixed Drink','Combine the vermouth, whiskey, bitters and ice in a mixing glass. Stir gently, don't bruise the spirits and cloud the drink. Place the cherry in a chilled cocktail glass and strain the whiskey mixture over the cherry. Rub the cut edge of the orange peel over the rim of the glass and twist it over the drink to release the oils but don't drop it in.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
VARIATION: No bitters. Substitute a twist of lime for the cherry and orange. Hold the lime twist in a lighted match over the drink and then drop it in. The heat really zips up the lime flavor.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Orange juice','Machine','1 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Vodka','Machine','1/2 oz ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Machine','Shot','Add the orange juice in the glass so it fills it about 1/3. Then take a napkin and put it over the glass pushing it down toward the juice. Push napkin down as far as it can go without touching the juice. Next pour the vodka very slowly so it dribbles on top of the juice. This will create a layer of vodka that lays on top of the juice because of the different densities of the liquids.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
Take this drink as if it were a shot. You will only tast orange juice--enjoy!!')

As far as mixing goes, I personally like to use Bailey's Irish Creme and Kuluha. If you love carrot cakes and like the nippy taste they have, add a little more Goldschlager, BUT BECAREFULL! Remember the Goldschlager is powerfull stuff, so even doubling the amount may kill the intended taste.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Orange peel','Irish Coffee #3','4 ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Lemon peel','Irish Coffee #3','4 ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Cloves','Irish Coffee #3','16 whole ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Cinnamon','Irish Coffee #3','1 stick ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Sugar','Irish Coffee #3','2 tsp ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Irish whiskey','Irish Coffee #3','1/4 pint ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Coffee','Irish Coffee #3','3/4 pint strong and hot ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Powdered sugar','Irish Coffee #3','')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Whipped cream','Irish Coffee #3','')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Irish Coffee #3','Mixed Drink','Stud the strips of orange and lemon peel with 2 cloves each and place them in a frying pan or chafing dish with the stick of cinnamon and the 2 teaspoons of sugar. Place over moderate heat, stirring occationally with a wooden spoon, until the sugar has melted. Pour the Irish Whiskey into the pan and light a match to the liquid. (Be sure to step back since the flame will flare up instantly.) Shake the pan to and fro slowly until the flame dies out. Pour in the hot coffee all at once and let it come to a simmer. Remove from the heat. Rub the cut edge of a strip of lemon peel around the inside of each the irish coffee cup and dip it into a dish of caster sugar so that the sugar adheres to the inside rim. Pour in the coffee, trying not to disturb the sugar. Top each serving with a dollop of whipped cream.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
This should be enough to serve two.')

INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Derailer','Mixed Drink','This is the punch we serve at our annual Halloween party. We use a big, black, plastic cauldron to mix this punch in. If you want... do as we do, and drop in chunks of dry-ice to create a bubbling, smoking cauldron of pure Halloweeen evil! It's safe to drink, and does not really change the taste all that much! YAHOO! GET DERAILED!
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
This punch really is not as bad as it sounds... it is quite palatable! Want to share your derailer experience? Write to me at bake@castle.net! Get derailed, and have fun!')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Malibu rum','Banana Cream Pi','1 oz ')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Pineapple juice','Banana Cream Pi','fill with ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Banana Cream Pi','Mixed Drink','This drink can be mixed with ice added, or put into a blender with ice, to be crushed. I like it on ice.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
I invented this drink when I went down to Daytona a little after bike week. The place was deserted, but cheap! I wanted something tropical and ordered pineapple juice with Malibu Rum. It wanted something to round it out and I asked for a shot of banana liquor to be added. Moments later I came up with a name (the bartenders hadn't heard of this drink before) - Banana Cream Pi, that's what it tastes like Banana, Cream, for Coconut cream, Pi for the Pineapple.')

Steam the snifter, using the 1/2oz. of 151 lighting it, until it consumes itself. After that pour the content of the shaker in the hot snifter. It will create a really good smelling cloud of smoke, that it's what distinguish this coktail.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
Be careful when lightning up the rum, and wait until it extinguishes, before pouring the contents of the shaker. or else the optical effect will not be that noticeable.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Jello','Jan's Jello Shots','0.35 oz (small boxI) ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Water','Jan's Jello Shots','1 cup boiling ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Vodka','Jan's Jello Shots','1 cup ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Jan's Jello Shots','Shot','Dissolve jello with 1 cup boiling water, add 1 cup vodka and srir, pour into shot glasses, ice trays, or in 1 oz plastic cups found at party supply stores (they even have little lids for them), chill until firm. Each person can use a knife or their tongue to loosen the edges of the jello and then suck them down. If you use the 1 oz plastic cups and lids you can serve them by placing all of the cups in a large bowl filled with ice...they will stay cold longer, and they look really festive! * Try making an assortment using several flavors of jello!
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
These are really great at a party....especially in the summer! ')

<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
This drink was improvised on New Year's Eve 1997 to celebrate my friend Roger's first exam at a private aviation academy. Unfortunately, he does not touch alcohol, so he will probably never taste it. Still, it was an instant success for everyone else attending the party. If you have any comments, suggestions or anything else-do mail me.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Ice','Dew-Driver #2','4 cubes ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Vodka','Dew-Driver #2','1 part Smirnoff ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Orange juice','Dew-Driver #2','2 parts ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Mountain Dew','Dew-Driver #2','1 dash ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Dew-Driver #2','Mixed Drink','The first thing to do is add the ice. 4 large cubes work well. Then add the vodka. A good way to measure is to fill it almost to the top of the ice cubes. Add the OJ until it is almost to the top of the glass and then add a little mountain dew. The more dew you add, the less vodka taste you have. (The oj also does a nice job of killing the vodka taste) . Then enjoy.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
A word of caution. This is pretty strong, but doesn't taste like it. If you see the 1/5 going down in less than an hour or so, stop for a while. Chances are you are already pretty drunk and it just hasn't hit you yet.')

To make it perfect, a slice of lemon is to be slid around the edge of the glass, and then put in the drink.

INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Blonde Smoothie','Mixed Drink','Scoop ice-cream into a large bowl (stainless or glass, but plastic will do). Slowly pour wine into bowl and mix until smooth (but not runny, or melted). Fold in (well drained) fruit cocktail. Serve in wine glass with ice-cream scoop (add tacky paper umbrella if desired). Keep in freezer when not being served.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
This mix will freeze in layers. When you take it out (some time later) let thaw slightly and remix. I usually keep a plastic wrap layer pressed down atop the mix to prevent freezer burn of the ice-cream (that's when ice crystals form, it won't hurt, but I don't really like the texture they add).')

INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Moilanen','Mixed Drink','First slice half a lemon in small slices. Then some ice, I prefer alot of ice in this drink. Pour the vodka in, press the rest of the lemon in the glass. Mix around and then fill up with Schweppes lemon. Mix again and you're finished. If you don't got the Schweppes lemon you can always use Fanta lemon instead, but it will be a lot sweeter.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
If you want a real Moilanen you should get a 1 1/2 litres plastic bottle, cut it of in the middle and use it as a glass. I've tried with a beer glass and it's not the same feeling but it will do. -- Invented it all by my self on a trip to Corfu in Greece. I prefer this drink in the summer, it's a real cooler. Enjoy!')

This drink comes from CROWN CASINO in Melbourne, Australia. We invented it and it has won several awards, so now we'd like to share it :) Hope you enjoy your "Field of Hearts".')

As with most punches, it's hard to be specific about the amounts used. A general rule: pour as much of everything as tastes good, then add more vodka! To make life more interesting, throw in pieces of fruit, and add dry ice to the cooler before serving. Small plastic animals also make a nice garnish (but don't drink them)!')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Heavy cream','David Caradine','1 part ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('David Caradine','Mixed Drink','Mix in the order: cacao, menthe, whiskey, milk. Try to keep the layers separate. Float on the back of a spoon, tilt the glass and pour very gently, etc. I suggest tilting the glass. When you tilt the glass you can, when pouring the cream/milk, rotate the glass causing the cream to swirl down through the other layers which looks good. Serve in an apertif glass.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
As you have noticed, the drink is basically a grasshopper. It is named after David Caradine's role in Kung Fu--Kane, whose nickname was grasshopper. It's a grasshopper that will kick your .')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Grain alcohol','Grain Punch','10 bottles ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Fruit punch','Grain Punch','4-5 packages ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Fruit','Grain Punch','Lots of ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Ice','Grain Punch','3 bags ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Grain Punch','Mixed Drink','First and foremost, BUY A NEW GARBAGE CAN, and wash it out thoroughly!!!!! (Preferably the big ones 40-55gal). First Pour in all of the Grain (10 bottles of 1.75ml [Handle]), keep in mind that this recipie is for a Large Party, not 10 people sitting around getting loaded.....Anyway, next add the dry packets of mix. We used to get the largest industrial bags we could, don't go for quality, you're not going to remember anyway. Now this is the most critical part, the fruit. This is why I put this on here...any joker can make punch, but I figured I would distibute my years of fruit research for free....the Best friends you have in the Fruit community are the Orange and the Apple. This is because they absorb the grain better than anything else I tested. So make sure you get some of these in every glass you get, and eat them, DON'T EVER THROW THESE OUT, this is the best part of the drink. Bananas suck, they get gushy, watermellon works ok but the seeds get to be a pain in the ass when you can't see so well, pineapple is good, basically you get the point. Cut the fruit into wedges and throw it in the mix and let it sit around for a minute...Now throw in the bags of ice and fill it up to desired potency with water, mixing can be done with a canoe paddle or a 2x4 or anything else you've got lying around...a disposable camera is usually a good partner while drinking this concoction, people get really outta hand and go off the deep end.....This goes well as an iceblock shot too.')

<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
Served at Norm's Beer and Brats, Superior, WI. Grenadine is poured into the mouth of a plastic shark, which is then placed tail-down in the drink. When patron is seated, they remove the shark and plunge it head-first into the vodka/lemonade mixture. Gives a nifty "blood" effect. Very sweet drink. Use caution with the straw, or the vodka will lay you out.')

INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Tripwire','Mixed Drink','In 5 gal. jug mix thoroughly all of vodka with all of lemons, lemonade, and water, which should be previously combined. Make sure water is ice cold, if not ice or refridgeration may be required.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
This is what we drink at the bar crawls in D.C. and Philadelphia. If mixed well and kept on ice the vodka is not noticed. It is easy to drink several eight ounse party cups and not notice the affect coming on. We call it tripwire because of the fact tht you don't perceive your impending drunkeness until it hits you suddenly and you fall over!')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Firewater','Sunny Sex','2 cl ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Red wine','Sunny Sex','1 cl ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Sunny Sex','Mixed Drink','First off, mix the orange juice with the malibu in a seperate glass, pour the firewater in the martini glass, the orange mix over it and when it's settled, pour the vodka slowly over the mixture. If you want you can stir now (in that case the above directions are void) - but i prefer not to. Now's the time for the red wine. It doesn't have to be anything special: I tend to use a Lambrusco because of the pearliness, also the amount of wine you use will affect the taste of the drink immensely. I use between 1/2 cl to 1 cl, not more, other wise the tatse of the wine will dominate too much. To get your optimal taste you'll just have to experiment a little back and forth.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
Hope y'all have fun with my drink, I invented it on a New Years Party 1995 in Germany (Oberndorf to be exact!).')

INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Real Romulan Ale','Shot','Select a bottle (preferably decorative, but not too ornate) that will hold just over 1 liter of liquid. Combine 375ml of each ingredient in the bottle. Marvel at the entrancing color and exquisite character that is The Ale. -- Put the bottle in your freezer and wait 2 hours. -- Pour a shot and hold on to your hat!
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
CAUTION: This drink is extremely alcoholic and quite flammable! Do NOT expose to open flame and drink responsibly! NOTE: If you're not one of the few that enjoys the sensation of white-hot liquid crawling down the back of your throat then you might want to consider "Romulan Ale Light". Simply follow the directions listed above and, when you're ready to imbibe, pour the shot in to a 12-ounce glass and fill with Sprite. Variations include strawberry soda, pineapple soda, orange sode, Cherry 7-Up, and grape soda. Remember, you haven't had REAL Romulan Ale until you've sucked down a shot!')

Put the shot on fire and drink it with a straw, or you have another choice: When the shot is on fire you slap it to extinguish the fire and then you drink it.

B-52 must be lighted!!! These ingredients are used in Switzerland.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Blue Curacao','Flaming Moz','1 part ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Sambuca','Flaming Moz','1 part white ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Green Chartreuse','Flaming Moz','1 part ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Flaming Moz','Mixed Drink','Place a short rock (wide mouthed spirit glass) on bar. Pour the blue curacao, white sambuca and chatreuse into a brandy balloon (snifter). Place the brandy balloon horizontally, balancing on the mouth of the short rock. -- Ignite the alcohol in the brandy balloon. Rotate the brandy balloon (like a cement mixer). Pour mixture from brandy balloon to short rock while it is alight. The stream of alcohol falling between the glasses should form a waterfall of fire cascading into the short rock. (I am a poet also) Use the upside down brandy balloon to suffocate the drink in the short rock. Be sure the flames are out. -- Remove the brandy balloon and inhale the fumes. Shoot the drink. -- Hold on to the bar very tightly!
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
You can substitute just about anything for the blue curacao and white sambucca, as long as they flame. A mixture of blue and red Galliano Sambucca makes a particularly good looking drink. Try adjusting the colour to suit your customer. Ask customer "what's your favourite colour?", and make it that colour. Great for birthdays and similar celebrations. If you're soft, you could probably do it without the chatreuse.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Olive','Dirty Martini','2 ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Dirty Martini','Mixed Drink','Put an ice cube and a small amount of water in cocktail glass. Place in freezer for 2-3 minutes. Fill mixer with all ingredients including garnish. cover and shake hard 3 or 4 times. it is ok to bruise the gin on this one. Remove cocktail glass from freezer, empty, strain drink into cocktail glass add olive from mixer. Serve with a mysterious smile...
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
This is salty... I mean SALTY! You will either love it or hate it immediately. I take my martinis this way all the time. If you like the flavor but the salt is a bit to much, just decrease olive juice to taste. The first dirty martini I had was not salty enough, so I added more juice..Enjoy!')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Champagne','Summer Mind Eraser','Top with ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Summer Mind Eraser','Shot','First, fill the champagne flute with heaps of ice. Next, pour in your Schnapps and Midori. Now fill the flute to the top with Champagne. Let the drink settle for a minute (especially if you've been pouring behind a busy, bumpy nightclub!). Use a long bar straw to drink the shot from the bottom up (push the straw right to the bottom of the flute before starting), all at once! Very Important - Don't stop in the middle of the drink!
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
I invented this drink at one of the hottest nightclubs in Sydney, Australia. The original Mind Eraser is a little much in our hot summers (especially when the air con. went out!). This one is quite refreshing, and packs even more of a punch than the original!')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Vodka','The Cum Shot','15 ml Stoli ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Peach schnapps','The Cum Shot','15 ml ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Kumquat','The Cum Shot','1 ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('The Cum Shot','Shot','Simply pour the Vodka and Schnapps into the shot glass. How you mix it is of no consequence, it's how you drink it that is important. First, take the stem off of the kumquat (unless you're really into foilage!). If you prefer, cut the kumquat in half (it really depends on the size of kumquats around the world, I suppose). Now plonk the fruit into your mouth and start chewin'- Don't swallow! When you figure the time is right (you'll know - When all the fruit juices have exploded in your mouth), throw back the shot chaser that you mixed in the beginning.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
This one tastes awesome, and will leave a great aftertaste in your mouth for ages. I invented this at my nightclub in Sydney, Australia, after visiting a buddy's Spanish club. They threw a couple of these tiny kumquats at me to try, I threw in the alcohol (because I can!), and thus a fruit shot (with a great name!) was born.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Ice','The Angry German','')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('The Angry German','Shot','Shake all ingredients with ice. Strain into shot glasses. Yell your favorite swear word and drink.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
Orgin of The Angry German: Named after Geneva, Illinois native Scott Hallahan. While at Beloit College, Scott was nicknamed Hans Gruber by Beloit Collge alum Eric Emery, due to excess swearing and threats of violence. At last count, Scott has appox. 26 different nicknames (including 'The Angry German). The drink was created at Bert's Other Place in Beloit, Wisconsin on July 10, 1997. The Angry German should taste like your least favorite cough syrup.')

<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
This is a simple drink but yields an intense experience. First one feels a chill on their lips. Next, the sour of the juice makes your taste buds explode. Finally the alcohol imparts a warming sensation to the throat. Caution: These go down so pleasantly it is easy to quickly over do it. Enjoy!')

I have made this drink quite often at parties and it goes over very well with everyone. Try it a few times it does take a little practice to get it right.

This shot is a favorite at all my parties so try and enjoy it.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Vodka','Kahlua #6','1 fifth ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Kahlua #6','Mixed Drink','Mix 3 cups water with 4 cups sugar, bring to boil and boil for 20 minutes. Set aside, add 1 whole vanilla bean split. Let mixture cool. Add 2 oz instant coffee to 1 cup boiling water. Stir until dissolved. Set aside & cool. When above are cool (important) put into a half gallon container and add the vodka. Let age for at least 3 weeks.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
Old family recipe. great taste and easy to make. Put in a neat container if want to use for gifts or just let it stay put and enjoy with friends and neighbors.')

<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
The Bernardete was created during one of the very famous sessions of Antares, a very well known and respected jazz club in Lleida, Spain during Christmas of 1996. It quickly expanded all over Spain and it is very usual to see it being served in the most prestigious clubs of Spain. Perfect drink for coloquial sessions where one needs to be aware of the conversation yet desires to have a nice touch of alcohol running through the veins. Wonderful drink created by fantastic people!!! Visca Lleida i l'Antares!!')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Malibu rum','Booda's Black Brew','1 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Blue Curacao','Booda's Black Brew','3/4 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Chambord raspberry liqueur','Booda's Black Brew','3/4 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Grenadine','Booda's Black Brew','1/2 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Cranberry juice','Booda's Black Brew','Fill with ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Ice','Booda's Black Brew','Fill with ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Booda's Black Brew','Mixed Drink','Hurricane Glass Fill with Ice 1oz. Malibu Rum or Parrots Bay Coocnut Rum 3/4oz. Blue Curacao 3/4oz. Chambord 1/2oz. Grenadine Fill with Cranberry Top and Shake
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
Well it was Halloween Night I was working (being the Rookie). I shaved my head and all my facial hair and I dressed up as Buhhda.Anyway some really hot chick asked me to make a Witches Brew. Me being a Rookie I didnt know how to make it. So to impress this girl I flew around the Bar I work at picking up every dark looking liquior trying to make something that looked and tasted cool. Then Pow she dark it and asked me "what the Hell was that??" and it just came out "Booda's Black Brew" I said. She licked her lips and says "Damn give me another!!" Then all her Fine little friends came and asked me for some Booda's Black Brew!!! And So a Drink was Born. I work at the Ale House and Raw Bar in FL and I have been called Booda for Years now so everything fit into place.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Sambuca','Fireball #3','1 part ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Tequila','Fireball #3','1 part ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Tabasco sauce','Fireball #3','5-10 drops ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Fireball #3','Shot','First add 1 part tequila to the shot glass. Then add the sambuca and a few drops of tabasco sauce. Instead of tabasco sauce you can add 2 to 3 coffee beans instead (try one of each and see what you like better). Pour some sambuca all over the glass and light it on fire. Let it burn for approx. 10 to 20 seconds. You can now leave it burn and sip through straw or blow out (carefully) and take it down like a normal shot. Don't forget to eat the beans. Have fun!
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
DO NOT use plastic shot glasses for this drink and if you are very easily affected by alcohol, do not eat the beans if that is what you used instead of tabasco because the beans absorbe all the alcohol.')

INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Nickler','Shot','Fill a tall shot glass with the cheapest brandy that you can find. Take your round slice of lemon and place it over the top of the pony glass. Pour sugar over one half of the lemon leaving the other half bare. Pour instant coffee over the other half of the lemon (next to the sugar). Fold the lemon slice in half and put in mouth biting off the rind. Chew and swallow the lemon combination and chase immediately with the brandy in the shot glass.

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Orange juice','Shrub','1 pint ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Lemon','Shrub','Juice and peel of 2-3 ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Rum','Shrub','2 qt ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Sugar','Shrub','2 lb ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Water','Shrub','1 qt ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Shrub','Mixed Drink','Begin with gentle fruit juices. Put a little less than 1 pint orange juice and the juice of 2 or 3 lemons into a half-gallon or gallon jar. Before squeezing the lemons, peel the rinds very thinly and add them as well. -- Add 2 quarts rum. Cover and let stand for three days. -- Put 2 pounds sugar into 1 quart water and bring to boil. Add the sugared water to the rum and fruit juice, cover, and let stand for two weeks. Then strain and bottle.')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Rum','Almond Shrub','1 qt ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Orange juice','Almond Shrub','1 glass ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Lemon','Almond Shrub','Rind of 1 ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Sugar','Almond Shrub','1/2 - 1 lb ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Milk','Almond Shrub','1 glass ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Almond flavoring','Almond Shrub','5 - 10 drops bitter ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Almond Shrub','Mixed Drink','Put into gallon or half-gallon jar the spirits, thin lemon peel, orange juice, and sugar. Now take the essence of bitter almonds (you can use any amount you please) and add it to the glass of milk. Mix thoroughly and pour into the jar. Cover, put in a warm place (65-70 degrees fahrenheit), and keep it there until the milk has curdled. This takes from one to three hours. Then filter through filter paper and bottle. Rest it for two weeks before drinking it.')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Orange','Rum Shrub','Rind and juice of 6 ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Water','Rum Shrub','1 pint cold ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Sugar','Rum Shrub','2 - 3 lb ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Orange juice','Rum Shrub','1 pint ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Rum','Rum Shrub','2 qt ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Rum Shrub','Mixed Drink','Pare 6 oranges very thinlyand put the rinds into a gallon jar. Add the juice of the fruit. Add 1 pint cold water, close the jar, and let the liquid stand for three days, stirring it now and then. train into an enamel dish, add 2 to 3 pounds sugar, and bring to a boil. Add a full pint of orange juice and strain it again. Finally, add about 2 quarts rum and bottle.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
It is a fine drink on a cold day, and you can use it a week after you have made it.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Canadian whisky','Rubber Chicken','3 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Limeade','Rubber Chicken','Fill with 1 part ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Ginger ale','Rubber Chicken','And 1 part ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Ice','Rubber Chicken','')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Rubber Chicken','Mixed Drink','Fill mason jar with ice. Pour in Rye Whiskey. Then top up with a 50/50 mix of limeade and ginger ale.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
This is the first drink we ever had. We got someone to go in and buy us some rum (when we were under age) but they bought us rye whiskey instead. We did not know what to mix it with so we got ginger ale and then some limeade. We mixed 3 oz drinks and it was smooth! We recommend Canadian Club Rye Whiskey as that is the BEST and it is what we used that night. The name came from a Phil Collins video," living in a nuclear world", when we were trying to figure out a name, a Rubber Chicken flew by on the video. That's all folks!')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Tennessee whiskey','Pooh Bear','1 shot ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Cream soda','Pooh Bear','Add ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Ice','Pooh Bear','')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Pooh Bear','Mixed Drink','Pour ingredients over ice.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
I made this drink up in college. It is named for my childhood hero and my favorite Disney character. Its sweet flavor and golden color remind me of that silly, nilly, willy old bear. I tend to like this drink best on hot, humid nights. The cream soda really takes the edge off of the whiskey. You can adjust the ingredients to taste, but too much cream soda tends to make this drink almost sickly-sweet. It's definitely a whiskey lover's drink.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Grapefruit','Norwegian Hunting Mixture Bowl','3 kg ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Norwegian Hunting Mixture Bowl','Mixed Drink','Fill approx. 2 gallon with pure Alcohol and 5 gallon with lemonade in a big and clean mixing bowl. Add approx. 10 kg. with fresh fruits as lemon, grapefruit and oranges. Mix the items together in approx. 2 minutes with an 4 HP outboard-motor with cooling- and exhaust system modified to not interfere with the mixture. Can be served in all kind of glasses but preferably a jar called "Norges-glass".
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
Norwegian hunting speciality invented by Academic Hunting Club 1984. A very popular drink in Norwegian Hunting Festivals.')

<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
Excelent hand warmer for cold nights plus some alcohol to warm the spirit. If Hot Chocoalte is made with milk, the milk will have a tendency to react with the Schnapps. Whole milk reacts more but gives a creamier taste. The whip cream will give a better (creamier) texture and taste to water based hot chocolate. ')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Beer','Wildfire','')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Wildfire','Mixed Drink','You need 3 shot glasses and a beer glass (I use a schooner - 425 mL - but of course use whatever you feel necessary). Put the tabasco sauce in one shot glass. This is the firestarter. The tequila shot is the propellant which spreads the fire. The peppermint schnapps shot brings the fire under control, and finally, the beer puts out the last of the flames.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
Someone told me this was created in honour of the bushfires in Australia. Any excuse for a drink! All I know is, after a few of these, you're toast. (And yes, it can be done - I thought it was only a joke at first too.) ')

<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
Anyone who has read the Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy can appreciate the name of this drink. Most of my customers have trouble pronouncing it. But you can have a lot of fun forcing people to remember it when they order. This one is very popular with the ladies, as it is VERY easy to drink, and hey, I just like the name of it.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Ice','Malibu Pink Panther','')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Malibu Pink Panther','Mixed Drink','In a blender, crush a hand full or two of ice. Then add the frozen pink lemonade and Malibu Rum. Blend until it becomes somewhat smooth (usually less than 30 seconds). Then add the whipped cream while leaving the blender running. This will add the consistency to your drink and therefore the amount of whipped cream is to your discression. Blend until smooth and serve.')

I made my sour mix from 3 parts sugar added to 2 parts water, then heated till boiling. This syrup mixture was then added to equal a equal part of Lemon or Lime juice. The ginger ale was to make the drink less sweet. My twist on the Whiskey Sour. I suggest using Rye Whiskey. - D.G. Dec/97.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Ice','Dutchie','')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Dutchie','Mixed Drink','Pour creme de banane, apricot brandy and cherry brandy into the beer mug. Drop in a few ice cubes, and fill mug 3/4 with milk. Slowly pour the ounce of advocaat over the top of the milk covering the surface. Now watch as the advocaat drips around the ice and through the milk. This affect is best when the advocaat has been chilled.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
This drink is very sweet, but the flavour is wonderful. I invented this drink while working as a bartender in northern Alberta. I named it "Dutchie" because Bols is a Dutch Liquer company.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Beer','Clara','1 part ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('7-Up','Clara','1 part ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Ice','Clara','3 ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Clara','Mixed Drink','The beer is first. The 7-Up is second. The ice is last, but it is only needed if the other ingredients aren't cold.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
The amount can be slightly more or less, depending on the drinker's preference. Women tend to prefer more 7-Up and men tend to prefer more beer when asked. BUT, half and half are the ususal measurements. -- This drink is very popular in most of Spain, but especially in Madrid. You order it if you really don't want to drink a lot. It's a very "social" drink. People not used to drinking find it very gentle. In Spain, 7-Up is known, but "gaseosa" is what's used in the drink. My Spanish friends who visit the USA prefer 7-Up to other "gaseosa" substitutes. ')

INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Flaming Spanish Fly','Mixed Drink','Moisten rim of glass with cherry juice or water. Dip rim into coarse sugar to coat heavily. Pour tequila and coffee liquor into glass. Gently float 151 proof rum on top. Carefully ignite rum and swirl glass to lightly melt sugar with flame. Immediately pour in coffee to extinguish flames and fill cup. Top with whipped cream and cherry.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
Serve with a florish, but sip slowly, it's hot and potent! This is a great hot coffee drink for those cold nights. Very intriguing to watch being assembled but, watch out, it can sneak up on you.')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Johnnie Walker','Sprawling Dubinsky','1 part ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Johnnie Walker','Sprawling Dubinsky','1 part ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Absolut Citron','Sprawling Dubinsky','1 part ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Amaretto','Sprawling Dubinsky','1 dash ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Sprawling Dubinsky','Shot','First, add one part of Johnnie Walker Red. Next add one part Johnnie Walker Black, followed by another part of Absolut Citron. Finally, throw in a touch of amaretto, for flavor.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
This drink was created in honor of famed Chicago Blackhawk Steve Dubinsky. Its inspiration came from a night of drinking and watching the Mighty Blackhawks. In an overtime thriller, Steve made a "sprawling" attempt to stop a shot. While his attempt to be hero failed miserably(and the Hawks lost), it still looked pretty cool. In honor of this moment we drank the innagural "Sprawling Dubinsky" one part Johnnie Walker Red and one part Johnnie Walker Black because of the Hawks colors. One part Citron, because the Hawks suck, and finally a touch of amaretto for flavor.')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Gold tequila','Brent's Tequila Head Slam','1/3 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Grenadine','Brent's Tequila Head Slam','1/3 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('7-Up','Brent's Tequila Head Slam','1/3 oz ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Brent's Tequila Head Slam','Shot','Build the three ingredients in a shot glass in the order listed. Fold a paper bar napkin and place firmly over the top. Slam the shot glass on the table, bar, etc. Make sure the drink fizzes. Turn the drink up and 'Slam It Into Your Head' before the fizzing subsides or try to be the first to re-slam the empty shot glass to the bar in a 'Group Head Slam'.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
This drink can be made as a regular or tall shot or can be built gently (so as to preserve the fizz) in a bottle for pouring into many individual shot glasses for a 'Group Head Slam'. Keep doing these 'til you understand the expression, "Eppa, Eppa, Andele!"')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Blue Curacao','Cryonic Shock','2 shots ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Whisky','Cryonic Shock','1 shot ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('White rum','Cryonic Shock','1 shot ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Metaxa','Cryonic Shock','1 shot ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Ouzo','Cryonic Shock','2 shots ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Lemon','Cryonic Shock','Juice of 1 ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Lime','Cryonic Shock','Juice of 1 ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Ice','Cryonic Shock','Add 8 cubes ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Cryonic Shock','Mixed Drink','Mix the Blue Curacao, Whisky, Rum, Brandy, Ouzo, Lemon and Lime juices in a blender. Pulse mixture for 2-3 seconds. Add the 8 ice cubes. Pulse for about 20-30 seconds or until desired consistency of ice is achieved.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
I created this drink last summer when I was looking for something strong yet tropical to drink. The high concentration of alcohol in the brandy, ouzo, etc. provided an array of fullness, while the Blue Curacao, lemon and lime juices provided the tropical flavour. The ice is there simply to chill the mixture and so that you experience brain freeze when you drink the thing. If you're still standing up straight after drinking one of these, let me know you're alive and that you had the balls to take the challenge of drinking one. Enjoy!')

INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Purple Love','Mixed Drink','Combine the first 9 ingredient into a cocktail shaker. Shake well for about 25 seconds. Strain the cocktail into a high-ball glass. The piece of melted chocolate is for garnish purposes. -- How to use the melted chocolate: First spread the melted chocolate evenly over a plastic board and leave it to cool and harden.Using a sharp knife, draw the blade across the chocolate to create curls. Add the curls to the top of the cocktail and serve.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
A sweet, creamy cocktail in an attractive shade of purple. It will be a popular drink among the ladies. -- *NOTE* You can subsitute the whipped cream with either vanilla ice-cream or vanilla milk. It will be sweeter if ice-cream is added. The ingredients would be quite costly. For cheaper Purple Love, you can subsitute the Chambord with cranberry juice or red grape juice.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Orange','Orange Bitters','1/2 lb dried bitter ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Cardamom','Orange Bitters','1 pinch ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Anise','Orange Bitters','1 pinch caraway or ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Coriander','Orange Bitters','1 pinch ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Grain alcohol','Orange Bitters','2 cups ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Water','Orange Bitters','boiling ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Caramel coloring','Orange Bitters','4 tblsp ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Orange Bitters','Mixed Drink','Chop the orange peel finely and mix it with the herbs and alcohol. Let it stand for 15-20 days in a sealed jar, agitating it every day. Pour off spirits through a cloth, and seal again. Put the strained off seeds and peel in a saucepan, crush it, cover with boiling water and simmer for 5 minutes. Pour into another jar, cover and let stand for 2 days. Strain this off and add it to the spirits. Add caramel coloring, filter again and let it rest until it settles perfectly clear.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
Orange Bitters is a common ingredient in older cocktails, but can be hard to find. This is a recipe to make your own.')

INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Grand Gold Margarita','Beer','Pour the the margarita mix, tequila, Cointreau, Grand Marnier, and beer into the blender. For frozen margaritas, fill the blender with ice cubes and blend until the ice is crushed. (For margaritas on the rocks, use less ice and blend until the ingredients are thoroughly mixed.) The beer will create a frothy texture for the margarita. Dip the rim of the margarita glass in lime juice and then salt the rim with margarita salt.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
This drink is extremely potent and is not intended for the feint of heart.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Orange juice','Fruit Pastille','Fill with ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Ice','Fruit Pastille','')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Fruit Pastille','Mixed Drink','Place ice cubes into the glass. Pour over measure of Gin, followed by the dry Vermouth. Then fill up to desired level with Orange Juice. Gently pour in dashes of Blue Curacao so that about 2/3rds of the orange goes green. Then pour in the dashes of Grenadine so the bottom of the drink turns red. Serve with straw.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
It gets the name fruit pastille as the resulting colour red, green, orange/yellow looks like a packet of fruit pastilles.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Bailey's irish cream','Brain Destroyer','1 part ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Kahlua','Brain Destroyer','1 part ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Amaretto','Brain Destroyer','1 part ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('151 proof rum','Brain Destroyer','1 dash Bacardi ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Brain Destroyer','Shot','Add the Bailey's, Kahlua, and Amaretto together in the shot glass. Then add a dash of Bacardi 151.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
Bacardi 151 is essential to the proper effect of this drink. The taste of the 151 should be hidden by the Bailey's, Kahlua, and Amaretto. The shot will go down smooth and hit hard a couple of minutes later - thus, the brain destroyer. How hard this drink hits depends on big a dash of 151 you add. Don't add too much or the shot won't go down smooth. Much respect must go out to my boy, Armand Aquino, who showed me how to make this shot. Enjoy!')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Aftershock','Poison Ivy','1/2 shot ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Kahlua','Poison Ivy','1/2 shot ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Poison Ivy','Shot','Pour chilled ingredients into a shot glass. Can be made layered or mixed. If layered pour the Aftershock in first, then slowly layer the Kahlua on top.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
This drink was created while I had a case of Poison Ivy. It has a special meaning. The Kahlua stands for the poison, and the Aftershock stands for the body. When layered, the poison has been touched. When mixed, the poisonous oils have been drank.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Bailey's irish cream','Fat Cat','1 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Amaretto','Fat Cat','1/2 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Banana liqueur','Fat Cat','1/2 oz ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Fat Cat','Shot','Fill mixing cup 1/4 full of ice. Add all three ingredents. Shake and strain into a shot glass. It can also be served on the rocks.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
I work at a restuarant as a bartender and there is a waitress who is from Turkey. She can not speak English very well so she often orders drinks mispronouning them. One day she ordered a fat cat on the rocks meaning vodka on the rocks. So the manager and I decided to invent a drink called a Fat Cat.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Peach schnapps','Inverted Traffic Light','1 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Orange juice','Inverted Traffic Light','')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Grenadine','Inverted Traffic Light','1/2 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Blue Curacao','Inverted Traffic Light','1/2 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Absolut Vodka','Inverted Traffic Light','1/2 oz ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Inverted Traffic Light','Mixed Drink','Fill cocktail glass with ice. Pour in the 1oz. of Peach Schnapps, then add orange juice 3/4 to the top and shake. Slowly add the 1/2oz. of Grenadine (watch it sink to the bottom of the glass). In a mixer, mix the 1/2oz. of Blue Curacao with the 1/2oz. of Vodka then, slowly strain into the cocktail glass (filled with oj and Grenadine). Voila! Your inverted Traffic Light. Note: The drink is consumed in layers and therefore, not stirred.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
The purpose on mixing the Blue Curacao with the Vodka is to enable the Blue to "float". Since it is a syrup in itself, if poured alone, the Blue Curacao would sink to the bottom, mix with the Grenadine and cause a hideous purple mess. When poured successfully, this drink makes an excellent conversation piece and can result in a rewarding night.')

Take lime wedge and run it over the edges of the margarita glass, then, upturned, place the wetted rims into course salt. Pour the now ready margarita into the now salted glasses and serve.

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Vodka','Pepe's Flame of Love Martini','2 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Sherry','Pepe's Flame of Love Martini','2-3 drops ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Orange','Pepe's Flame of Love Martini','2 ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Ice','Pepe's Flame of Love Martini','')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Pepe's Flame of Love Martini','Mixed Drink','As explained from the great bartender Pepe Ruiz of Beverly Hills Chasen's Restauraunt: "You swirl a few drops of La Ina Sherry in a chilled stem glass and pour it out. Than squeeze a strip of Orange peel into the glass and flambe' it with a with match. Throw away the peel. Now fill the glass with Ice to chill again, then throw that out. Add vodka, than flambe' another orange peel around the rim. Now throw out the second burnt peel. Then just stir it gently. And drink, drink."
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
The great Dean Martin was responsible for the creation of this drink. He regularly visited the bar at Chasen's in Beverly Hills and told the bartender - Pepe Ruiz - that he was bored with the same old Martini's. Pepe than spent three weeks experimenting until he came up with this drink. Dean was reportedly floored by this drink and it soon became his favorite Martini. Frank Sinatra immortalized the drink in a 1962 recording entitled "Nothing But the Best (Is Good Enough for Me)". The lines "I like my martini, with burn on the glass" is a veiled tribute to the drink. Hollywood legend has it that Frank ordered 65 of the drinks in one night - for his guests.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Ouzo','Hairy Armpit','1 shot ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Grapefruit juice','Hairy Armpit','')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Hairy Armpit','Mixed Drink','Place three ice cubes in glass. Pour in ouzo and fill with fresh grapefruit juice. Stir well and serve.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
The Hairy Armpit can be surprisingly tasty, but it depends on fresh ingredients. One made with pasteurized grapefruit juice and old, partially-evaporated ouzo has proven to be an unpleasent experience. Sambuca can be used instead of ouzo, especially if the grapefruit juice used is particularly sour. As far as I know, this drink was invented by James Clippinger and named by Matt Calef. If someone has an earlier reference to either the name or receipe, please let me know.')

INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Sex on the Brain','Mixed Drink','Fill glass with ice, insert a straw and then add the first three ingredients (Vodka, Midori, Schnapps) then layer the juices using a barspoon to get a separation of alcohol and mixers. Leave a little room at top of glass to float the Sloe gin on top. Garnish with a cherry and orange wedge. The drink should look like a Stop Light. Green at the bottom, yellow in the middle and red on top.

Can also be made into a blended drink by adding all ingredients into a blender and served in a margarita glass. Garnish with only a orange wedge.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Kahlua','The Gold, The Bad, and The Ugly','1 1/2 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Bailey's irish cream','The Gold, The Bad, and The Ugly','1 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Milk','The Gold, The Bad, and The Ugly','Fill with ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Goldschlager','The Gold, The Bad, and The Ugly','1 1/2 oz ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('The Gold, The Bad, and The Ugly','Mixed Drink','When you're filling with milk, make sure you leave enough room for the Goldschlager. Pour the Goldschlager over the back of a spoon.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
The drink ends up layered if you leave it for a minute or so. The Goldschlager will be on top, the milk and Bailey's stay mixed, and there's a sort of Kahlua sludge at the bottom. This is how I prefer to drink it. My roommate, however, likes to continually stir his as he's drinking it. I don't normally measure out the ingredients when I start playing alchemist. I just pour until it looks right. To that end, the measurements here are estimations. You can vary the ingredients to suit your taste. Modifications I've tried include sprinkling cinnamon on the top and adding chocolate syrup. Cheers.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Spiced rum','Oklahoma Tropical Twister','1 1/2 oz Captain Morgan's ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Orange','Oklahoma Tropical Twister','')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Pineapple','Oklahoma Tropical Twister','')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Maraschino cherry','Oklahoma Tropical Twister','')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Oklahoma Tropical Twister','Mixed Drink','Place both cans of Cream of Coconut (unopened) in hot water for 10 minutes. Then pour the Pineapple Juice, Orange Juice, Cream of Coconut, and Grenadine in a large punch bowl. Stir for 3 minutes to ensure proper mixture. You can add the liqour in with the mix or add it to each drink as it is poured. 1.5 oz per 12 oz drink. By leaving out the Spiced Rum the kids can drink this as well. It is a great NAB drink. Serve over crushed ice. Place the Pineapple Wedge, Orange Wedge, and the Cherry on a tooth pick and drop in drink. For a Oklahoma Frozen Twister place all the ingredients in a blender with a 12 oz cup of ice and blend til smooth. Then add garnish.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
Great with Spiced Rum. Great as a NAB drink. Great served over crushed Ice. Great as a Frozen Drink. The drink for every member at the party, including the kids.')

INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Michelada Regular','Beer','Add lemon juice to the ice cubes in beer mug. Add salt and stir to blend. Add tequila and stir to blend. Fill with Corona, Sol or Dos Equis.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
Very popular drink for the beach in the Puerto Vallarta area. Is refreshing and delicious. An alternative ingredient is called "sal de gusano" (worm salt), made in Oaxaca, Mexico, and is made from toasted agave worms, chili and salt, using it istead of regular salt. Be careful, though, to use only 1/4 of a teaspoon on this one, because it is VERY strong (but tastes really great).')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Vodka','Summer Sucker','1/2 bottle ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Grenadine','Summer Sucker','1 cup ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('7-Up','Summer Sucker','2 cans ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Watermelon','Summer Sucker','1 ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Summer Sucker','Mixed Drink','Cut a small, circular hole in the watermelon. Save the piece cut out. Turn the watermelon with the hole facing the ground so any juices drip out. Mix the vodka, grenadine and 7-Up in a seperate bowl. Slowly pour the mix into the watermelon (use a funnel if you have one). If you put the liquid too fast into the watermelon, it wont absorb properly. Pop the piece you cut out back into the hole. Shake the melon. Throw it in the fridge for an afternoon. When the family is over, cut slices out of the watermelon and enjoy.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
It's worth the effort. It's rumored Mark Twain enjoyed this special treat, albeit with bourbon rather than vodka. Kids like it too. Note: this is not to be performed during any season other than summer. Cheers.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Cranberry juice','Bot','2 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Vodka','Bot','2 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Triple sec','Bot','1/2 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Lime juice','Bot','1/2 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Orange juice','Bot','1 dash ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Bot','Mixed Drink','The easy way to make this drink is to add all listed ingredients with ice into shaker and strain into glass. However, the really slick way is much more impressive: Add cranberry juice, lime juice, tripple sec and only one ounce vodka into shaker with ice. Strain into glass. Then, mix 1 once orange juice with one ounce vodka in a seperate glass. Fill a turkey baister with the vodka/OJ mix, and slowly inject it into the cranberry glass on the bottom. This produces a sort of reverse-layering effect, and also ensures both cranberry and OJ will have the same amount of vodka.')

INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Russian Iceberg','Shot','Fill tumbler with ice. Lean to 45 degree angle and pour creme de menthe down the side of the glass to fill bottom. Stick a straw in the middle of the drink and drink the whole drink at once through the straw.

This will taste like a shot of scope, but the effects of one drink will make you wish it was just scope. For added effect, make all liquids 1.5oz. This drink was given to me by some Texas Tech frat guys who were working as bartenders at an Outback Steakhouse.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Absolut Vodka','Donna Reed','2 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Ice','Donna Reed','1 cup ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Cranberry juice','Donna Reed','4 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Sour mix','Donna Reed','4 oz ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Donna Reed','Mixed Drink','Start by crushing the ice in a blender. Add the cranberry juice (more or less to taste) and sour mix, blend a few more seconds. Add the Vodka and blend again. If done properly, this drink should be frothy for a bit, and then separate as it sits. Serve in cocktail or margarita glasses. It won't hurt to put it in the freezer for a short time (enough to slush it some).
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
Called a Donna Reed for two reasons: (1) it's pink (2) it was originally created in a 1950's-vintage blender. Fairly mild taste, not much alcohol.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Dark rum','Jo Jo Original','1 shot ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Amaretto','Jo Jo Original','1/2 shot ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Ice','Jo Jo Original','5 cubes ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Cola','Jo Jo Original','Fill with ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('151 proof rum','Jo Jo Original','1 splash ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Jo Jo Original','Mixed Drink','Fill old fashioned glass with ice. Add Dark Rum and Amaretto. Fill with Coke. Add splash of High Proof Rum to taste.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
This is an old Seattle party drink. It is rumored to have been originaly made with eight(!) different Rums, Amaretto and a Mason Jar by some of this cities best "mixologists". Legend says that it was mixed to appease a large group of people who were tired of drinking "rum and cokes" using only the ingrediants from a bar that was stocked almost entirely with rum. This drink is a great example of how similar ingrediants can be used to create drinks with entirely different tastes. Enjoy.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Ice','The Dash','2 ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Advocaat','The Dash','1 shot ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Creme de Fraise','The Dash','1 shot ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('The Dash','Shot','Pop a couple of ice cubes in the glass. Pour the advocaat slowly over the ice. Then wait for a moment before adding the creme de fraise. Serve it as soon as it's poured as it starts to curdle.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
Well it all started in a wine bar in London. Myself Josh "The Baptist" Murray and Andy "Hatchett" Hockey (Baptising the stomach in beer, and put it down the hatch). We were after our favourite tipple, A Flaming Arsehole (advocaat and cherry brandy), and disaster struck... no cherry brandy. After much consultation with Pete the barman, it was decided that the only honourable substitute was creme de fraise, and low the dash was born. Enjoy it, its a pleasure.')

This is a B-52 clone. You should put the shot on fire before drinking it with or without a straw. Amarula is a South African product. There are Rhinos in South Africa. <H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
This bizarre shot originated in a club in Toronto when a friend of mine (after quite a few drinks) said he would drink any shot: namely tequila, wine and amaretto. I didn't think wine would go too well, so I substituted lime, and bought him the shot. He said it tasted good, and the TLA was born. Of course, bartenders still look at us funny whenever we order it...')
