INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Brandy','Feliz Natal','1/2 part ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Feliz Natal','Mixed Drink','Stir all ingredients together in the glass with a couple of ice cubes and enjoy!
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
Feliz Natal is Portuguese for Happy Christmas and the cocktail is inspired by the flavours of a rich liqueur chocolate cake eaten at this time of year. The heady flavours of Brandy and Port from the Douro region of Portugal, some dried cherries, wrapped in Marzipan and coated in chocolate. Let christmas last all year! Feliz Natal!')

INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Thal on the rocks','Mixed Drink','Take the highball, put in 3 to 4 ice cubes, add 1 cl of creme de cassis (not cooled), then 4 cl of preferably Absolut Vodka along with 2 cl of Gordon's Dry. Taste: refreshing ideal summer drink although highly alcoholic. Origin: got the idea while working as a bartender, was asked to create some fresh but nonetheless strong alcoholic mix.')

INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Fridays Frozen Mudslide','Mixed Drink','Begin by crushing the 8 ice cubes in a blender. When ice is finely crushed, add the remaining ingredients and blend for 45 seconds on blender's highest setting. Pour into glass and serve immediately.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
This mudslide approximates the delicious (but expensive) mudslide offered by the restuarant named after everyone's favorite day of the week. It is rich in chocolate taste and packs a hidden punch behind its rich decadent creamy flavor. I got the recipe from the bartender at the restuarant. Be sure to use a high-quality ice cream. For those that dislike the strong slightly bitter coffee flavor imparted by Kahlua, reduce the Kahlua to 1/2 oz and add 1 oz milk.')

Add margarita mix, tequila, grand marnier, cointreau, triple sec, irish mist, and 5 ice cubes in a shaker. Shake vigorously until thoroughly mixed and cold. Pour into margarita glass and garnish with a lime wheel. Adding a maraschino cherry is an interesting touch.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
I created this margarita variation to utilize the very best top shelf ingredients and impart a smooth citrus-lime-orange taste. All of the liqueurs used are derived from the orange (and most are quite high in alcohol content). This margarita is surprisingly sweet and smooth. Make one of these and you'll probably make another. A variation of this recipe would be to add 1/4 oz. Blue Curacao. ')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Cointreau','Genuine Singapore Sling','1/4 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Benedictine','Genuine Singapore Sling','1/4 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Grenadine','Genuine Singapore Sling','1/3 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Angostura bitters','Genuine Singapore Sling','1 dash ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Genuine Singapore Sling','Mixed Drink','Combine all of the ingredients in a shaker, fill with ice and shake until the shaker is well frosted. Strain into a tall glass and garnish with a slice of pineapple and cherry.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
I've got this recipe from Raffles Hotel, Singapore, where it was originally invented. Singapore Sling was created at Raffles Hotel at the turn-of-the-century by Hainanese-Chinese bartender Mr Ngiam Tong Boon. Originally, the Singapore Sling was meant as a woman's drink, hence the attractive pink colour.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Vodka','Zimamazing','2 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Gin','Zimamazing','2 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Rum','Zimamazing','2 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Tequila','Zimamazing','2 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Triple sec','Zimamazing','4 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Sour mix','Zimamazing','4 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Zima','Zimamazing','1 bottle ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Zimamazing','Mixed Drink','Shake the first six ingredients without ice until frothy. Fill glass with ice and pour Zima and the contents of the shaker in a one-to-one ratio. Stir and serve. Makes about four drinks.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
It's tastes like an Electric Lemonade with Zima instead of lemon-lime soda and more sour mix. Instead of Triple Sec, you can also use Blue Curacao. It makes it a pretty blue-green drink. Also, keep a LOT of extra ice on hand because this drink has so much alcohol it melts the ice immediately, which is why you should not put ice in the shaker, it will dilute the drink.')

"Blonde" comes from how it looks, and my hair color is blonde. "Ron" comes from "Ron" Bacardi that is printed on the label and my name happens to be Ron. It is a light sweet drink that I like and so do alot of my customers at the last bar I worked. I never liked rum and coke because of the taste and just drank rum and 7up for along time till I happened to different juices, cranberry, and OJ are the other ones that taste OK.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Orange','Saurian Brandy','1/4 cup grated ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Vodka','Saurian Brandy','1 pint 100 proof ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Sugar','Saurian Brandy','1 cup ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Maple syrup','Saurian Brandy','2/3 cup grade "A" ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Saurian Brandy','Mixed Drink','Put orange rind in a half-pint jar with 1/4 cup vodka. Seal it and shake occasionally. Let it steep overnight. -- Pour sugar and 1 2/3 cups vodka into a 28 ounce bottle. Seal it and shake until all the sugar is dissolved, then add the maple syrup. -- Filter the orange extract through a fine handkerchief or coffee filter until it becomes clear. -- Add a tablespoon of the final extract to the vodka syrup mixture and mix well. If your orange peels are much more or less aromatic than average, adjust the quantity so that you have enough to hide the maple flavor, without having enough to make the liqueur bitter or recognizably orange flavored.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
The recipe comes from the 'Official Star Trek Cooking Manual' (Bantam Books 1978) by Mary Ann Piccard, but not even Paramount will acknowledge it anymore. ')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Lemon','Italian Limoncello','Zest of 15 fresh ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Vodka','Italian Limoncello','2 fifth 100 proof ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Sugar','Italian Limoncello','4 cups ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Water','Italian Limoncello','5 cups ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Italian Limoncello','Mixed Drink','Wash the lemons with a vegetable brush and hot water to remove any reside of pesticides or wax. Carefully zest the lemons with a zester or vegetable peeler so there is no white pith on the peel. -- In a 1-gallon glass jar, add one fifth vodka and the lemon zest. Cover the jar and let sit at room temperature for at least 10 days, and up to 40 days in a cool dark place. -- In a large saucepan, combine the sugar and water and cook until thickened, appx. 5 to 7 minutes. Let the syrup cool before adding it to the limoncello mixture. Add the additional fifth of vodka. Allow to rest for another 10 to 40 days. -- After the rest period, strain and bottle, discarding the lemon zest. Keep in the freezer until ready to serve.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
Remember that the longer the zest and vodka mix rests, the better the taste will be.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Zima','Dudley's Damnation','12 bottles ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Sprite','Dudley's Damnation','6 L ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Limeade','Dudley's Damnation','2 cans ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Vodka','Dudley's Damnation','1/2 gal ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Dudley's Damnation','Mixed Drink','Take a Good size cooler, any with a drain plug will do, and pour in a 12 pack of Zima. Then pour in your 6 liters of sprite along with the 2 cans of limeade. Then pour the 1/2 gallon of vodka in with the rest of it. Stir until the limeade has dissolved totaly, and there you go. Makes roughly 5 gallons.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
If you get this one right you are in for a good time. it is very hard to get any taste of alcohol form this drink even though it will knock you on your ass in a heart beat. It tastes like a lemony lime type drink. This bevarge was the result of week long drunken escape at the beach with all of my friends. We found that everyone we brought to our place to party loved this drink, guys and girls equally. I promise this is a great party drink and everyone will love it. You can either dip it out of the cooler or drink it right from the drain plug. The latter of the two will more than likely get you a nice bill form local hospital though.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Blue Curacao','Yoda','1 part ')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Midori melon liqueur','Yoda','1 part ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Sour Apple Pucker','Yoda','2 parts ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Vodka','Yoda','1 splash ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Ice','Yoda','1/2 handful ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Yoda','Mixed Drink','Mix the Sour Mix and Blue Curacao together in a shaker, or if you don't have a shaker, two identical glasses will work if you are careful. Use more or less Blue Curacao depending on how green your Sour mix was to begin with. Once those are mixed into a nice green color, add the Midori and then the Pucker. Finally add the splash of Vodka, and mix a couple more times, then pour over ice.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
Like Yoda, this drink is green and powerful. If you want a slightly less powerful Yoda, you can leave the Vodka out. If you want a more powerful drink, obviously add more Vodka. This drink is very sour, but if you like Midori sours, or pucker, you should love this.')

This drink was invented at the Atlantis Resort on Paradise Island, Nassau, Bahamas during the Bad Boys I Cruise. It's your basic (but good) Pina Colada but made with Tequila instead of Rum. Why? Because it was Tequila day when it was invented. It's a favorite with the ladies. Enjoy!')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('151 proof rum','Slugger's Delight','1 shot ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Rock and rye','Slugger's Delight','12 oz ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Slugger's Delight','Mixed Drink','Pour the Rock & Rye into a glass with ice. While the Rock & Rye is still fizzing, quickly add the 151 proof rum. Stir thouroughly before drinking. (Heavy concentrations of 151 have been known to cause a few sore throats.) Enjoy!!!
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
This drink dates back to the old party days after baseball practice. The traditional Rum and Coke became too boring and weak, so ordinary rum gave way to 151 rum. Then one night there was no more Coke, so we settled for Rock & Rye. We never bought Coke again. As you'll see, the taste is far superior and the product packs a punch.')

<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
This drink is an adaptation that I learned from a friend in Tacoma, WA. This drink is superior to anything like it because of the fact that using the Absolut Kurant, which is a berry flavored vodka, doesn't kill the flavor of the raspberry taste like a straight vodka does. Also, even though you use Roses lime juice, do not omit the fresh lime. You will definately notice a difference in the taste because the lime juice has sugar in it and it mellows out the sour taste. Enjoy!')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Orange juice','Brian Sinnott Family Punch - Leaded','6 oz frozen ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Lemonade','Brian Sinnott Family Punch - Leaded','6 oz frozen ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Water','Brian Sinnott Family Punch - Leaded','2 qt ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Sugar','Brian Sinnott Family Punch - Leaded','2 cups ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Ice','Brian Sinnott Family Punch - Leaded','2 qt ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Vodka','Brian Sinnott Family Punch - Leaded','1 1/2 cup ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('White rum','Brian Sinnott Family Punch - Leaded','1 1/2 cup ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Ginger ale','Brian Sinnott Family Punch - Leaded','2 L ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Champagne','Brian Sinnott Family Punch - Leaded','1 bottle ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Brian Sinnott Family Punch - Leaded','Mixed Drink','Mix Kool-Aid, juice, lemonaid, sugar, and water. Add booze and ice cubes and let cool. Add champange and ginger ale before serving. Adjust punch to party mood with more vodka.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
I was first introduced to this drink in its "unleaded" form while attending some 1997 holiday festivities. Brian Sinnott is an ex-fiance of Kristine Hunter, middle sister of Beth Hunter, who is my ex-wife. Anyway, his family created this tremendously wonderful "kool-aid" punch, and used it for all of their family occasions. Through careful scientific experimentation, I have created a wonderful and magnificent champagne-kool-aid punch to use for parties, New Year, Christmas, birthday celebrations, etc. Printed above are instructions for the "leaded" version of the drink. Be careful, it can pack quite a blow, especially if you add more vodka, as suggested. This is a sweet drink, so cheep Andre "pink" champagne or any other sparkling wine will do. I would recommend using a good brand of vodka, then potency adjustments are less noticeable. This is a wonderful tasting champagne punch, despite its Kool-Aid roots. One batch is probably good for a party of 5-10 people. Make two batches for medium parties of 10-20 people. (This also maximizes the fact that frozen juice usually comes in 12oz sizes anyway.)')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Green Chartreuse','Hakkespett','5 cl ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Hakkespett','Shot','Layer Cointreau and Chartreuse in the glass. Ignite with a match, lick the palm of your hand and cover the glass with it. Shake it a little bit after the glass has fastened itself. Remove your hand slowly while inhaling the air inside, shot the entire contents, put two fingers in your mouth, inhale sharply and deeply, and then try to say: "Hakkespett!" (In English: "Woodpecker!") Good luck!
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
Origin: Musikerlåfte' på Studentersamfundet i Trondheim')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Orange juice','Sweet Solution','3-6 tblsp frozen ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Sweet Solution','Mixed Drink','Fill a tall glass or cup with ice cubes, about 1/3 of the way full. Add the shots of tequila, adding more or less depending on the size of the cup. Then fill up most of the cup with raspberry lemonade, and add the frozen orange juice concentrate. Mix it well with a spoon until everything is well blended.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
I made this up one day at my brother's house when I was very drunk and I had tequila and juice. And now it is my drink of choice, probably one of the best drinks I have ever had. And my friend Anna helped me make up the name when I could'nt think of anything cool. So give it a try, I promise you will not be disappointed.')

<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
Found this one in a hotel bar in Toronto. It's got a sweet taste to it, perfect for those who don't like to taste the alcohol but like to get drunk. Larger amounts of amaretto can be used because the cranberry juice sort of eliminates the taste of it. Enjoy!')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Irish cream','Irish Cactus','2 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Tequila','Irish Cactus','1 oz ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Irish Cactus','Mixed Drink','Pour Irish Cream and Tequila over ice and stir.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
Tastes alot better than it sounds. I came up with this out of nessesity. The wife likes Irish cream and brandy and I like Tequila so I put the Tequila in her Irish Cream to try it out,Yumm. While traveling I asked a Bartender for Irish Cream and Tequila on the rocks and he said,"you whant what!? what do you call that"? I said, "I don't know what do you think it should be called"? The Bartender replied "Irish Cactus" and thats what I have called this drink ever since.')

INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Captain Morgan's Steamy Applecolada Dream','Mixed Drink','Start with hot or steamed apple cider. Add equal parts apple schnapps, spiced rum and coconut rum. Stir.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
This very tasty, and warms-you-from-the-inside-out adult beverage started with a request for Spiced Apple Rum at a holiday party. The bartender's interpretation of Captain Morgan's was Captain Morgan's 'Parrot Bay' vs. the spiced rum our favorite pirate is known for. We added the remaining ingredients anyway, and voila--a star is born.')

INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Midori Jello Shots','Shot','Warm the bottle of Midori so that it is hot to the touch, by first loosening the cap half way, then set the entire bottle in a saucepan half full of water on high heat. <H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
A surprisingly good drink that was discovered entirely by accident - mixing with grapefruit juice alone was too sour, 7-up alone was too plain, but when I added a splash of grapefruit to the 7-up mix, I was pleasantly surprised. It was named for a roommate at her suggestion.')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Grenadine','American Pie','1 tsp ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Vodka','American Pie','2 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Sweet and sour','American Pie','1/3 ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('7-Up','American Pie','2/3 ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Blue Curacao','American Pie','1/2 oz ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('American Pie','Mixed Drink','Pour grenadine in glass. Add straw and ice carefully. Fill 1/3 of glass with sweet and sour. Add Vodka. Fill glass almost to the rim with 7-up. Add Blue Curacao. Do not stir.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
This drink has the same ingredients as a Purple haze or Purple hooter. The key difference is in presentation. When properly made, it becomes a tall semi-layered drink that can be produced with minimal effort. I came up with this drink after a request the bar owner had to make a pretty drink that was simple and all our own.')

INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Strawberry Fields','Mixed Drink','Blend strawberries into 4 oz puree, add 2 oz of rum (and some sugar if you want to) and blend for a couple of second. It takes a little work, but it is worth it. Cool all engredients before making the drink so you don't have to use ice. Use hurricane or highball glasses. -- This drink was created on a hot night when a cool drink was needed. It really worked great. ThanX to An! (she bought the fruit).')

<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
My friend Amanda and I invented this one! It should be done as a body shot. One person lays on the ground/bed/table/etc. with the shot glass held in his/her mouth. The drinker "mounts" the holder and must take the shot without using her/his hands! It's a lot of fun, and a great icebreaker!')

<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
New Year's Eve milineum a group of us were up at Hunter Montain, New York. Remembering back to college days we wanted to make Russian Qualudes, only we did not have any Kaluha. We adjusted the proportions of the rest of the ingredients and came up with this delicious drink, the "Hunter Mountain". (Can also be used for shots.)')

<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
I've been spending a lot of time over the last month learning how and practicing at the art of Bartending. Last night while at a local bar I was looking over what they had on the back shelf and asked the Bartender to whip this up for me. It tastes a lot like a banana milkshake. INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Peach','Homemade Southern Comfort','1 1/2 lb ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Sugar','Homemade Southern Comfort','1 cup ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Lemon peel','Homemade Southern Comfort','4 strips ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Bourbon','Homemade Southern Comfort','2 cups ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Homemade Southern Comfort','Mixed Drink','Peel, pit and slice peaches. Place in saucepan. Add sugar, stir well to combine. Warm over low heat until sugar is well dissolved and peaches are juicy. Place mixture into aging container. Add lemon peels and alcohol, stirring to combine. Cover container and put in a cool, dark place (or refrigerate if necessary). Stand for 1 week, stirring occasionally. Strain and filter: press out liquid from peaches with the back of a wooden spoon. Strain again. Ready for cooking now, ready for drinking in another month.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
Variations: add 2 cinnamon sticks and 4 whole cloves.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Ice-cream','Aggie Banana','2 scoops ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Milk','Aggie Banana','1 cup whole ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Banana','Aggie Banana','2 sliced frozen ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Ice','Aggie Banana','1 handful ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Butterscotch schnapps','Aggie Banana','2 oz ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Aggie Banana','Mixed Drink','Blend ice cream, milk, and frozen bananas until smooth. Add Schnapps, blend, and pour.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
If ice flecks are desired, add ice and use fresh, not frozen, bananas. -- For best handling and taste, first peel and slice the bananas. Put them in an uncovered plastic bowl to freeze. Allow frost to form on them. -- I use vanilla ice cream for this drink. But I think it would also be good with almond ice cream. -- This is a great drink for banana lovers. The butterscotch gives it a nice sweet flavoring without overpowering the bananas. As far as I know, this is an original drink. I got the idea one day because I was making a banana shake and trying to get rid of some left over butterscotch instant pudding. So, I added the pudding to the shake, and it was wonderful. Then, I started experimenting and came up with this. I was not sure what to name the drink. I decided on Aggie Banana because I'm a student at Texas A&M University, and if it weren't for me being an Aggie, I would have never thought of this. WHOOP!')

<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
This drink was created by James Bond in the 1953 book "Casino Royale" by Ian Fleming. It is named for his femme fatale - Vesper Lynd - and Bond remarked: "I never have more than one drink before dinner. But I do like that one to be large and very strong and very cold and very well-made. I hate small portions of anything, particularly when they taste bad."')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Vodka','The Mormon Surprise','1 part ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('White grape juice','The Mormon Surprise','2 1/2 parts ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Ginger ale','The Mormon Surprise','Fill with ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('The Mormon Surprise','Mixed Drink','Add the vodka and the grape juice first in any order and then fill with ginger ale.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
People who don't like vodka love this drink because the white grape juice covers the unpleasantness of Vodka. -- Origin: As you may know, The Mormon religion forbids consumption of alcohol (along with many other things). So, in order to compensate for this fact, my Mormom friends serve the best punch anybody at their parties has ever tasted. I once asked for the ingredients to this nectar and they gladly gave them to me. A year and a half later lapsed in which time I completely forgot about the punch. However, I instantly recalled the mix at college when I saw the ingredients in my fridge. I made some of the punch right away and, remembering that alcohol makes anything better, added various liquors and spirits to the punch until I found the perfect compliment to surprise Mormons worldwide: vodka.')

INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('BMW #2','Shot','Shake with ice and strain into shot glass.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
Back in the day, two bartenders at Philthy McNasty's in Waterloo, Ontario, Canada were sitting around the bar trying different alcohols, trying to find the best tasting shot with a real smooth taste and a great aftertaste that you can still taste after a few more drinks. After trying about 15 shots each they started getting sloppy and careless. One of them grabbed the three bottles and mixed them up. He shot it back and the look of pure joy appeared on his face. The other one tried it and this was the beginning of the tastiest shot I've ever had. They came up with this shot and I wanted to share this great shot with all of you. ')

My friends and I came up with this drink on my birthday with the ingredients I already had in my house. Best if consumed through a straw with lots of ice, or well chilled.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Whipped cream','Marianne','')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Marianne','Mixed Drink','Blend strawberries, raspberries and apple juice until it is slushy. Fill each champagne flute half way with fruit mix. <H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
The history and origin of this drink is from a group of creative UC Berkeley students trying to celebrate Marianne's birthday. We have dedicated this drink to her! It is both a refreshing and juicy uplifter, definitely an elegant party drink. Add cake and good music! The amount of champagne and fruit mix can be varied accordingly to personal taste.')

INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('The Cherry Magician','Mixed Drink','This is to make one quart. Follow the directions on the package to determine the appropriate amount of Kool-Aid mix. Mix all of the ingredients in a bowl/pitcher without ice. Serve in a glass with ice.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
Caution: This is a strong drink, believe your first sips. After the first few sips the cherry flavor will dominate and the taste of alcohol will essentially dissappear, hence the name.')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Guinness stout','Guinness Punch','12 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Condensed milk','Guinness Punch','1/2 cup sweetened ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Cinnamon','Guinness Punch','1/16  tsp (or less) ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Nutmeg','Guinness Punch','1/16  tsp (or less) ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Cocoa powder','Guinness Punch','unsweetened ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Guinness Punch','Beer','Gently pour a well-chilled Guinness into a small mixing bowl or glass that will hold all of the liquid ingredients. Add the sweetened condensed milk, spices, and cocoa (if it's wanted). Stir or whisk well, and pour the mixture into a pint-sized beer mug or pub glass. Makes 1 drink.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
This is a Jamaican drink that may also be found in some Jamaican restaurants in the US and UK. It tastes a lot like Chai Tea, but not as sweet. The malty bitterness of the Guinness is there, especially in the aftertaste, but it's softer than straight Guinness. If Sam Adams Cream Stout is used, there is almost no bitterness at all, and the drink seems sweeter.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Gold tequila','No Regrets','1/2 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Bailey's irish cream','No Regrets','1/2 oz ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('No Regrets','Shot','Pour in the Irish Cream first. Then add the gold tequila. Shoot down and feel the warmth.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
The sweet of the Irish Cream mellows out the bite of the tequila. Or if you prefer, the bite of the tequila tones down the sweetness of the Irish cream. Either way, this definitely will wake up your mouth and make you feel warm inside. -- An alternate way of mixing this drink comes from its origin. One person has 1 oz of tequila in her/his mouth. The other person holds 1 oz of Irish Cream in her/his mouth mouth. Kiss and let the alcohols mix. Warning: this alternate way will produce more warm feelings than the method outlined above (and possibly a few regrets, lol).')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('7-Up','Mansion Mind Eraser','Fill with ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Mansion Mind Eraser','Mixed Drink','Fill glass with ice cubes. Pour all the ingredients in order and fill with 7-Up. Drink with two straws like a shot.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
A drink for two people. Tastes like a chocolate milkshake. This particular Mind Eraser originated (as far as I can tell) in The Mansion, a nightclub in West Texas, and was served almost exclusively behind the bar. It was too good to share with the patrons.')

<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
I accidentally "discovered" this drink one summer when we were mixing Mint Juleps and we had a whole bunch of sugar syrup and bourbon, but ran out of mint. It's tangy and sweet, but you can modify the sweetnes by substituting club soda for ginger ale. Both add a nice bubbly character.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Banana liqueur','Tropical Titty Twister','1/2 shot ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Coconut rum','Tropical Titty Twister','1/2 shot ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Orange vodka','Tropical Titty Twister','1 splash ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Raspberry vodka','Tropical Titty Twister','1 splash ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Cranberry juice','Tropical Titty Twister','1/2 shot ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Soda water','Tropical Titty Twister','1 splash ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Pineapple juice','Tropical Titty Twister','1 1/2 shot ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Tropical Titty Twister','Mixed Drink','Mix in glass then shake.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
The flavor comes from the banana liquer, coconut rum, and pinapple juice. Cranberry juice is used to break the acidity of the pinapple juice, while the soda water breaks up the sweetness. The flavored vodka adds a twist and some kick. Knowing this you can vary the recipe to your liking. Can be made stronger by adding more flavored vodka. Also great if mixed in a blender. -- Created in a night club in Courtenay, BC in May 2000.')

<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
Great for big parties! If you want to do it for a big party, blend all ingredients in a big bowl. Fill a mixer and mix thoroughly. INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Banana liqueur','The Rising Skirt','1/2 oz ')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Sour mix','The Rising Skirt','1 splash ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Pineapple juice','The Rising Skirt','1 splash ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('The Rising Skirt','Mixed Drink','Pour all ingredients into a shaker and shake well. Pour in a sour glass with ice and top with an orange slice.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
This is absolutely delicious! The color is almost like Mountain Dew. It is very pretty and very strong! It is not too sweet as it may seem just by reading the ingredients. -- It is called the Rising Skirt because it was deemed a girl drink by a golfer at Lafayette Golf and Country Club (where it was created). After each drink, the girl's skirt may get shorter and shorter.')

<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
Origin: An off-campus dorm room at Slippery Rock University, one January weekend. Was named after one of the girl's because she was known as Jeannie on the internet and she was the one just mixing things that tasted good.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Cointreau','Black Feather','1 part ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Angostura bitters','Black Feather','1 dash ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Black Feather','Mixed Drink','Stir with ice. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with an Orange Twist.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
This is a French inspired cocktail, using specifically French ingredients (except for the bitters). The Cointreau should not be too strong in this drink, it should just add a background note. When in doubt, increase the brandy, and decrease the Cointreau. If you are lucky enough to have Abbott's Bitters, that is what this drink was originally designed to use.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Lager','Juicy Guiness Premier','Fill With Carling Premier ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Juicy Guiness Premier','Beer','Mix in the shots of Blue Curacao, Taboo and Vodka. Then add the Guiness to the spirits up to 3cm below the rim of the pint glass. Allow the Guiness to settle before adding the Carling Premier. Allow to settle again before consuming.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
A brilliantly fantastic concoction developed in Chamberlain Hall bar over the term of 98/99. Has to be poured correctly to taste nice otherwise the Premier takes the taste away. It does taste of shit to start with but it does get better as you reach the half pint mark. Also makes your mouth very blue... Rakish!!! Pilgrim says it's the way forward.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Triple sec','Buttsex','1 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Lemon juice','Buttsex','1/3 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Whipped cream','Buttsex','Fill with ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Buttsex','Mixed Drink','Start with the coffee, preferably espresso. Add in the vodka, triple sec and lemon juice (lime juice can be used instead) and stir. Top with the whipped cream.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
The word "buttsex" is an inside joke with a select few friends. This was created for New Year's Eve 1999, and drunk as the ball dropped. It's really an acquired taste, and if you have a weak stomach I suggest leaving out the triple sec and lemon. Be sure to get some whipped cream with every drink or this will kick your butt.')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Absolut Citron','Flaming Lemon Drop','1 1/2 shot ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Galliano','Flaming Lemon Drop','1 splash ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Lemon','Flaming Lemon Drop','1/2 slice ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Sugar','Flaming Lemon Drop','1/4 tsp ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('151 proof rum','Flaming Lemon Drop','1/4 tsp ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Flaming Lemon Drop','Shot','Pour Absolut Citron into shot glass and top off with a splash of Galliano. Place one half lemon slice flat on the rim of the shot glass, put some sugar on the slice and soak the sugar with 151 proof rum. -- Just before drinking, ignite the sugar. Blow the flame out when the it seems to caramelize the sugar. Lick the sugar off the lemon slice, down the vodka mixture, then either suck the juices or bite the pulp of the lemon.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
If you have ever had a lemon drop candy as a child this drink will surely bring back memories! This drink proves what one can invent when totally bored and full access to a stocked bar!')

<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
This drink originated in Berkeley as I was speaking to the new barkeep who had Irish heritage. I myself am of Mexican heritage so together we created the San Patricio (said in Spanish). It is named after the Irish-American troop that sided with the Mexican's during the Mexican-American War. Optional variations include a 1 oz. shot of Bushmills or a 1 oz. shot of Añejo Tequila.')

INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Grandma's Swingin' Eggnog','Mixed Drink','Beat yolks until light. Add sugar and mix well. Add milk and rum. Mix well, then chill for at least 3 hours. One hour before serving, whip cream and stir into chilled mixture. Return to refrigerator for an hour. Serve in punch cups and dust with nutmeg. Serves 20.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
This stuff is *potent*, even if you reduce the rum by half. Brandy, dark rum or bourbon may be substituted for the light rum. If you prefer a nonalcoholic eggnog, leave out the booze altogether. With or without booze, this eggnog is very rich and very good. ')

INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Key West Lemonade','Mixed Drink','Mix vodka and sweet and sour proportionally in any size batch, then add sprite or 7-up and cranberry accordingly, a dash each per serving. Directions are for single, regular bar size serving.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
People will suck this drink down, there is no hint of alcohol when mixed properly. Just watch out when the drinkers try to walk after having a few, that's 2 shots of Vodka per serving. A big glass will have many ounces of vodka and you can't taste it at all. Drink responsibly, this one can get you and you won't know it till you try to stand up!! Thanks to April in Key West for this one, it's been a long time favorite for me. Wish I could remember the bar name, some place by Mallory Square across from the Pirates Den. Figures I remember that place.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Creme de Cacao','Long Island Milkshake','1 shot ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Vanilla extract','Long Island Milkshake','1-2 drop ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Long Island Milkshake','Mixed Drink','In a large blender cup, add ice, sugar cubes, creme de cacao, vanilla extract (optional), and the cream or Half & Half. Mix for no more than 5-10 seconds. Then add the alcoholic beverages in no particular order, then hit the "frappe" or "whip" button on the blender for 15-20 seconds, or until you can see that all the ingredients are well-blended, but before you over-blend and start the ice melting too fast. Serve in a tall pre-chilled Tom Collins or similar tall iced-tea glass. No garnish required, serve with a large-diameter straw. ')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Vodka','D.P.R.','1 1/2 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Triple sec','D.P.R.','1 1/2 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Cranberry juice','D.P.R.','Add ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Club soda','D.P.R.','Top off 1 splash ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('D.P.R.','Mixed Drink','Fill collins or tall glass with ice. Add 1 ounce of vodka and .5 ounces of triple sec. Fill with cranberry juice leaving about an inch of space for a splash of club soda. Garnish with a slice of lime on the rim of the glass and place one thin straw into the glass.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
This is a simple but a very smooth and refreshing drink. I came up with it while working as a banquet bartender at a hotel near the beach in Southern California. In the summer some functions were held outside where it was very beautiful overlooking the ocean but could be quite warm. On hosted bars some guests (especially women) who were not big drinkers but wanted to join in the festivities would ask for a drink which was not very strong in alcohol or liquor taste. So I came up with this recipe which I received many compliments on. If you want to add more of a jolt to it, just bump up the amounts of vodka and triple sec.')

Pour the drink inside the pineapple again (without the ice) and put the top back again, do a small hole in the top and serve with a straw.

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Sambuca','Lick-Her-Itch','1/2 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Vodka','Lick-Her-Itch','1 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Cranberry juice','Lick-Her-Itch','1/2 oz ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Cherry','Lick-Her-Itch','1 ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Lick-Her-Itch','Shot','Mix in a mixing glass with a little ice, Start with Sambuca, add vodka, and then cranberry juice. Shake and Strain into a rocks/shooter glass with no ice. Garnish with a single cherry.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
This is a "shooter" drink that I came up with myself. It is a favorite with younger "college" customers. The name is a "take-off" of the licorice flavor of the drink. -- So far, I have come up with 2 varriants: #1. Same as original but cut the vodka to 1/2 oz. then add 1/2 oz. sloe gin. The name of the drink than becomes "lick-her-itch sloely" -- #2. Same as the original, just add 1/2 oz. cream and serve as a cream style (I.E. Pink squirrel) drink. The name of the drink then becomes "lick-her-creamy-itch". -- A third possible varriant that a few customers have requested (which actually tastes rather nasty) is the same as #2 with the 1/2 oz. cream addition. (Sloely lick her creamy itch)')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Whipped cream','A Smile','1 scoop ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('A Smile','Mixed Drink','With three ice cubes put vodka, light rum, cassis, orange juice, and frozen lemonade made at double strength into a shaker. Shake well. Place half the grenadine in the bottom of each white wine glass, pour in shaken mixture till withine inch of rim. With a large spoon drop whipped cream carefully in glass. Take small spoon spread to all the edges and to look nice. Serve. Makes two glasses.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
As you drink rock the glass in your hand between sips to get the full flavour. Enjoy.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Creme de Cacao','Powdered Chocolate Donut','1/2 shot white ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Malibu rum','Powdered Chocolate Donut','1/2 shot ')
INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Powdered sugar','Powdered Chocolate Donut','1 pinch ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Powdered Chocolate Donut','Shot','Pour equal parts of malibu rum and creme de cacao into a shot glass. Sprinkle the top lightly with powdered sugar.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
Created at the Fireside Tavern in the poconos, PA, as yet another collaborative effort by Fireside's resident Barkeep, and Mitch, of the Moose Head Lounge in West Nyack, NY. After mixing many experimental shots, only a few made the grade. This was probably the tastiest of all of them. After trying the shot, Mitch did not even hesitate on the name. Immediately, he blurted, "Taste's just like a chocolate donut." The other patrons there at the time tried it, and all agreed... The confectioner's sugar came later, but it truly is the crowning touch to the flavor. This shot is a must, for those partygoers with a sweet tooth...')

After the drink is mixed, you can either add the ice, and blend again, or simply pour the drink over the ice. Then you can either add the ice, and blend again, or simply pour the drink over the ice. This drink should be put in a 8oz mug that has been chilled in the freezer for best enjoyment. The drink should taste sweet, almost like ice cream, if it's not, add more sugar, or milk to taste. *note* For an "added kick" use a bit of bourbon (Jim Beam).')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Alizé','Strawberry Soak','750 ml ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Strawberry Soak','Mixed Drink','Sprinkle sugar over diced strawberries, and toss by hand in a bowl. Pour Alize over strawberries, and let soak for 15 min. to a half an hour. Strain mixture well, and store in Alize bottle for later use. Will yeild more than a bottle, so have another empty bottle ready in reserve.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
Invented by a baker from Hawaii. Created as a by product while marinating strawberries for a dessert. Serve shaken on the rocks with no ice.')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Strawberries','Frozen Strawberry Margarita','8 oz ')

INSERT INTO Makes (TypeName,Drinkname,Quantity) VALUES ('Tequila','Frozen Strawberry Margarita','2 oz ')
INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Frozen Strawberry Margarita','Mixed Drink','Put about 8 ounces of crushable ice cubes in a blender with blades that are capable of crushing ice. Add 8 oz of frozen (but thawed) strawberries in sugar sauce. (Available in the frozen foods section of your grocery store). Add sweet and sour mix and tequila. (Triple sec is not needed due to sweetness in strawberry sauce). Blend until desired consistency is obtained. Pour in large clear glass and garnish with a strawberry if available and a straw.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
To make a Frozen Strawberry Daiquiri, do the exact same as above, but replace the tequila with a light rum.')

<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
First time I tried this drink was actually in Cognac, the town that has given its name to the drink. CT is of course short for Cognac & Tonic, and is basically just replacing the gin in Gin&Tonic with cognac. And please don't use your best cognac for this!')

INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Man In A Man Suit','Mixed Drink','Shake the fruit juice and add it to the bowl (make sure it is pure fruit juice), mix in the vodka, whisky and southern comfort. Carefully float the 151 proof rum on the top, light it, but snuff it out before it all burns off. Several people drink it from the bottom with a straw at the same time.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
Try it without the fruit juice in shot form taking turns to fill your shot glasss' from the bowl. Originated in a military boarding school in Kent.')

INSERT INTO Drinks (DrinkName,Category,Recipe) VALUES ('Brioni','Mixed Drink','Pour liquor over ice cubes in a Collins glass. Fill with club soda, stir to mix, and add orange slice for garnish.
<H3>Creator/contributor's comments:</H3>
My variation on the "Negroni". It's less alcoholic switching dry vermouth for gin, and with club soda it makes for a very refreshing summer drink!')
